componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
Hello {{{Recipient.FirstName}}},

As Bekie Berg had introduced me in her previous email, I am your local sales representative and I look forward to talking with you. Anytime you have a challenge and need a solution, give me a call. If I can’t help you find a solution, I can bring in a Technical Representative to help us. My contact info is below.

I would like to share these thoughts with you:

One-part or two-part floor graphic system? That is the question.
While a one-part floor product may provide initial cost savings, direct print to the surface means the ink becomes the walking surface and can fade over time as well as compromise slip resistance. If that surface is textured, it will tend to collect dirt and debris that can result in abrasion and degrading of the graphic.

A two-part system, which consists of a base film and overlaminate, may appear to cost more; however, two-part systems do not collect dirt and debris, and the overlaminate provides abrasion resistance and extends the life of the graphic. This can mean less frequent change-outs due to abrasion, making for an equal or even lower total applied cost over time. In addition, the overlaminate provides a consistent walking surface that has been tested for slip resistance (such as UL 410), and that surface does not change when the ink type and deposition changes as the creative changes.

componentInstanceProperties.name: richTextValue
componentInstanceProperties.value:
As always, please reach out to me to start a conversation.

{{{Sender.Signature}}}

Hello {{{Recipient.FirstName}}},

FLEXcon is committed to providing you the highest level of service. That said, I’d like to take this opportunity to introduce your local FLEXcon Sales Representative as another resource to reach out to when you have questions, ideas, or need assistance finding a solution to an opportunity.

As the Retail & Advertising Product Manager I am eager to share helpful information on the market. Here is an article on Floor, Carpet, and Outdoor Walkway Graphics – Key Considerations... enjoy!
